alert.note: Alert for San Luis Obispo (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 18 at 2:47PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Southwest San Luis Obispo County. * WHEN...Until 345 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 246 PM PST, Gauge reports indicated heavy rain, up to 0.6 inches per hour. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pismo Beach, Arroyo Grande, Nipomo, Grover Beach, Lake Lopez, Oceano, Shell Beach and Avila Beach. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
